itemDescription: English cricketer and rugby union footballer (1878-1947)

wikipedia_page.main: Alfred Ernest Hind (7 April 1878 – 21 March 1947) was an English sportsman who played first-class cricket for Cambridge University and represented England at rugby union.

response: |416||Alfred Hind||wing ||1905-12-02||v New Zealand at Crystal Palace

In 1903, while still a Cambridge player, Cave was approached to join the British Isles team on their tour of South Africa. Cave was one of four Cambridge players on the tour, being joined by David Bedell-Sivright, Thomas Gibson and Alfred Hind. The tour took in 22 matches, mostly against regional and invitational teams, but also included three Test games against the South Africa national rugby union team. Cave was a regular choice throughout the tour, missing just two games, and played in all three Tests.William Cave Lions profile lionsrugby.com During the tour, Cave scored two tries; his first was in the win over a Grahamstown team, but more importantly he scored one of two British tries in the First Test with South Africa, played in Johannesburg.Great Britain tour – Johannesburg, 26 August 1903 Scrum.com The game ended in a draw.
* Alfred Hind (1878–1947), English cricketer and rugby union player
